support_summary: Glycogen synthase kinase 3 beta (GSK3B) directly interacts with and phosphorylates ATXN3 at Serine 256. This interaction, confirmed by affinity capture-western and in vitro reconstituted complex assays, regulates the aggregation of ATXN3.

functions.cellular_process: Glycogen synthase kinase 3 beta (GSK3B) is a serine/threonine kinase that directly phosphorylates ATXN3 at the Serine 256 (S256) residue.
functions.effect_description: The phosphorylation of ATXN3 at S256 by GSK3B is a key regulatory step that prevents the formation of toxic protein aggregates, which are characteristic of Machado-Joseph disease. By maintaining ATXN3 in a monomeric state, this phosphorylation reduces its cytotoxicity.
biological_consequence: GSK3B directly binds to ATXN3 → GSK3B phosphorylates ATXN3 at Serine 256 → Phosphorylated ATXN3 remains in a monomeric state → Formation of high molecular weight aggregates is prevented → Reduced cytotoxicity associated with polyQ-expanded ATXN3.
specific_effects: GSK3B-mediated phosphorylation at S256 inhibits the aggregation of polyQ-expanded ATXN3.
An S256A mutant of ATXN3, which cannot be phosphorylated, readily forms high molecular weight aggregates.
A phosphomimetic S256D mutant of ATXN3 remains monomeric, mimicking the effect of phosphorylation.
The molecular chaperone Hsp70 can suppress the aggregation of the non-phosphorylatable S256A mutant.

evidence.paper_title: Phosphorylation of ataxin-3 by glycogen synthase kinase 3beta at serine 256 regulates the aggregation of ataxin-3
evidence.relevant_quote: Here we show that S256 site in ataxin-3 is phosphorylated by GSK 3beta. Moreover, S256A mutant of expanded ataxin-3 forms high molecular weight protein aggregation, whereas S256D mutant and expanded ataxin-3 without mutation on this site are monomeric... Our results imply that phosphorylation of serine 256 in ataxin-3 by GSK 3beta regulates ataxin-3 aggregation.

mechanism: Glycogen synthase kinase 3 beta (GSK3B) is a serine/threonine kinase that directly phosphorylates ATXN3 at the Serine 256 (S256) residue.
effect: The phosphorylation of ATXN3 at S256 by GSK3B is a key regulatory step that prevents the formation of toxic protein aggregates, which are characteristic of Machado-Joseph disease. By maintaining ATXN3 in a monomeric state, this phosphorylation reduces its cytotoxicity.
summary: ATXN3 inhibits GSK3B to modulate atxn3 aggregation, ultimately affecting reduced cytotoxicity associated with polyq-expanded atxn3.
